title: Epstein and Barak invest in Carbyne surveillance tech founded by Unit 8200 chief
summary: Jeffrey Epstein and Ehud Barak jointly invested in Carbyne (formerly Reporty Homeland Security), a surveillance technology company co-founded by Pinchas Buchris, former head of Israel's Unit 8200 signals intelligence unit. Carbyne's technology provides "complete access to the caller's camera and GPS" during emergency calls. The partnership aimed to "seek out opportunities in the surveillance industry and build connections with powerful figures," including Peter Thiel who later invested $15 million through Founders Fund in 2018.
